comprehensive_overview: Lumpy is a structural variant caller that can detect various types of genomic variations using paired-end short reads, such as deletions, insertions, inversions, and duplications. It provides insights into the structural organization of a genome.
core_features:
1. Detects structural variants from paired-end short reads
2. Identifies deletions, insertions, inversions, and duplications
3. Provides information on the structural organization of the genome
4. Can be used for variant discovery and genotyping
